quotes.quote: Evaluation by others is not a guide for me.
Every decision you make reflects your evaluation of who you are.
Rational assessments too often led to rational surrenders.
Assessment is today's means of modifying tomorrow's instruction.
On assessment: measure what you value instead of valuing only what you can measure.
External things are not the problem. It's your assessment of them. Which you can erase right now.
Any assessment of where we stand in relationship to Him tells us that we do not stand at all. We kneel.
Assessments should compare the performance of students to a set of expectations, never to the performance of other students.
Life is now a constant assessment of whether what's happening in real life is more entertaining than what's happening on my phone.
Honestly admitting what you lost and not trying to rationalize it or push it off is an important step in self-assessment and mindfulness.
Without proper self-evaluation, failure is inevitable.
A man ought never to trust another man’s evaluation of a third man’s disposition.
Some people's unwillingness to think for themselves represents accurate self-evaluation.
If you have a high evaluation of yourself then your ability to recognize new facts is weakened.
It's objective evaluations that give our hardwiring principles teeth and drive the organization toward results that last.
The natural response to evaluation is to feel judged. We have to mature to a place where we respond to it with gratitude, and love feedback.

To be the best next-generation leader you can be, you must enlist the help of others. Self-evaluation is helpful, but evaluation from someone else is essential. You need a leadership coach. Coaching enables a leader to go further faster.

Evaluation is creation: hear it, you creators! Evaluating is itself the most valuable treasure of all that we value. It is only through evaluation that value exists: and without evaluation the nut of existence would be hollow. Hear it, you creators!

Any evaluation which implies rightness or wrongness is a tragic, suicidal expression of an unmet need. Tragic, first because it decreases our likelihood of getting our need met! Even if we think it. And secondly, because it increases the likelihood of violence. That's why I'm suggesting any evaluation which implies rightness or wrongness is a tragic, suicidal expression of an unmet need. Say the need! Learn a need-consciousness.
Courage is not the absence of fear, but rather the assessment that something else is more important than fear.
Act after having made assessments. The one who first knows the measure of far and near wins - this is the rule of armed struggle.
The thesis that risk assessment itself is inherently risky is nowhere better borne out than in the area of high-consequence risks.
Some of the most interesting research that I did was about risk assessment and how ordinary citizens like me handle risk assessment and how irregular our risk assessments are.
Making resolutions is a cleansing ritual of self-assessment and repentance that demands personal honesty and, ultimately, reinforces humility. Breaking them is part of the cycle.

The environmental assessment should give us the answers to all the issues that have been raised: potential lead migration, endangered species, noise abatement and proper disposal of shot, shells and things.
Proper evaluations of words and letters in their phonetic and associated sense can bring the people of earth to the clear light of pure cosmic wisdom.

Evaluation and coaching get tangled together. When this occurs, the noise of evaluation drowns out coaching efforts. Think of this like a term paper. When you get your assignment grade back (evaluation) you tend to tune out the professor notes in the margins (coaching) if the grade is higher or lower than expected.
